Posts.Content: I know your young and it's hard to believe that you might have breast cancer  When I first went to see my doc she thought it was just a cyst I had  Got mammogram, ultra sound and biopsies  1 week later I got my oncology results  I didn't worry at first but when I got told I had breast cancer my world fell apart You trust your doc and then to get told you have cancer it's a nightmare  I'm the only 1 in my family ever to have had cancer Now after 2 ops chemo & rads I can now see the light at the end of the tunnel I'm actually looking forward to seeing my surgeon in may for my reconstruction  I'll get my annual mammogram first to make sure there's nothing there. I was 46 when I got diagnosed which is still young for cancer I was told because I'm sterilised I'm unlikely to get ovarian cancer  Which is a bonus As soon as you know your results then at least no matter what the outcome is we're all here for you. I really hope it is benine especially at your age. Good luck  Val x
Posts.Title: 25 years old and possible breast cancer.

Posts.Content: Hi bunty-ann. I'm post op 2 weeks today. I only got my tumor removed on my right breast and I feel like my skin is red raw but the doctor said it could just be nerves that lie just under the skin. I get my results tmrw to see if they got it all. If not I've to get another operation. I know exactly how you feel . I just started on this site aswell and it's the best place to ask as much questions as you like. Please hang in there
Posts.Title: Im newby here

Posts.Content: Got all my little marks all over me . Scan went well. Start my radiotherapy on 27th  I'm really happy as I've been out with my walking frame.  It felt so great to get a walk and some fresh air.  I'm starting to feel a little normal now after my walk. Have to go too the shop tmrw as when I got back from hospital app the shop was closed  but it's fine . Val x
Posts.Title: C,T scan . Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Congratulations  I hope the big day has lovely weather for you I bet your so nervous Have a lovely day Val
Posts.Title: Good News Story for a cold Tuesday

Posts.Content: So sorry to hear about your dad My condolences  Your family will understand if you can't make the funeral Your health comes first It's also understandable you want to be at the funeral It's not a great time for a loved one dying especially when your going through cancer treatment  Keep your chin up and I really do hope all works out for you getting to your dad's funeral Take care  Cyber hugs  Val x
Posts.Title: Fifth day of radiotherapy, and my sister rings me ...

Posts.Content: Hi eni I had to wait 4 weeks until I got my lumpectomy and when they did remove it. It was 26mm with no evidence of spread Hope this makes you feel better  Val x
Posts.Title: Results after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Jeanneb  I got cording after my surgery and it went away on its own. Some do go to a specialist to pop the cords but I never. Hope all goes well for you  Val x
Posts.Title: How do I get rid of cording?

Posts.Content: Well done I got my friend to shave mine off but he didn't do a great job so I used my lady shaver to shave of the rest and it worked I wouldn't recommend for younger girls with a great head of hair  I congratulate you for going for it Well dine  Val x
Posts.Title: I've done it! Shaved my head today...

Posts.Content: Ha ha ha ha  That's so good Val x
Posts.Title: Feeling so happy

Posts.Content: I mind of that advert with the timote shampoo Trust me it doesn't take long for your hair to fall out if your not cold capping  Val x
Posts.Title: Feeling so happy

Posts.Content: Just back from my follow up appointment with oncologist.  All is well. I'm free from hospital appointments for 5 months now until I see my surgeon again. I think I'm going to have a nap as I'm so tired today. My hair is growing nicely but like a lot of you it's coming back curly. Can't wait to use my straightners again. Val x
Posts.Title: Feeling so happy

Posts.Content: Thankyou lakomtekp. Wishing each and everyone of you a very merry Christmas and all the best for 2017. Val x
Posts.Title: Feeling so happy

Posts.Content: Mine is still short but can brush it a little. Can't wait until it's longer I'm so glad you can do that  Val x
Posts.Title: Feeling so happy

Posts.Content: Thank you Londonlass,  I'm on painkillers anyway and will be taking them before I go too hospital.  My gorgeous little grandson George is doing really well and has just been weighed he's now 10lb 7oz That's  him 4weeks & 2days old.  He's a little fatty My mobility is still the same so been in a lot of pain But I'm good & happy  Can't wait to get this mammogram over & done with Val x
Posts.Title: Breast clinic (mammogram )

Posts.Content: I'm a little nervous but not as bad as I thought I would be but it's not Friday yet ha ha Val x
Posts.Title: Breast clinic (mammogram )

Posts.Content: That's me home from my mammogram and I'll get my results in about 4-6 weeks and earlier if anything is found but I am positive there ain't anything there Hopefully once I get my results and the all clear I'll get my reconstruction  It was a little painful on the breast where I had the cancer but I got through it  ♥Val x
Posts.Title: Breast clinic (mammogram )

Posts.Content: Ha ha absolutely love it.  I can just imagine a man going through that Val x
Posts.Title: Breast clinic (mammogram )

Posts.Content: Hi sally-lou.  I got diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma in march and I thought my life was falling apart. I got a lumpectomy in my right breast Luckily it hadn't spread I did have 2 ops as they didn't get enough margin when they did the lumpectomy  I've had 3 fec-chemo and now I'm about to have docetaxel for 3 cycles I'm finding it hard the now due to other health problems I have and in severe pain as a result of a muscle disease When I first found macmillan and hearing everyone's stories and how they all got through having cancer I started to see a light at the end of the tunnel  Now I've went back a few steps due to my mobility issues. Please don't be scared about other pains around your body as I know exactlyhow you feel as I was exactly the same It started driving me insane wondering if it was anywhere else in my body  When I got the pathology results back and they told me they got all the tumor I felt so relieved  Everything will go through your head  If you keep doing that to yourself you will make yourself Ill with worry . Take each day as it comes  Pace yourself  Stay calm Love and hugs  Val xx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed this week - helpless

Posts.Content: Hi everyone hope your all doing well  I had to rearrange my mammogram appointment from the 17th to this Friday the 4th. Getting so close to my reconstruction  I'm so excited.  It's a morning appointment which I'd rather have  George is doing very well & getting plenty of pics & video calls  My son & his girlfriend have got a new house which they'll be moving in to this month plus my son got promoted in his job Everything's going well Just hope my appointment on Friday goes as well Vale x
Posts.Title: Breast clinic (mammogram )

Posts.Content: My hair started to fall out on day 12 by day 19 I had very thin hair that was noticeable so I got my friend to shave it off. Val x
Posts.Title: how long did it take for your hair to fall out on EC?

Posts.Content: I feel so nervous about tmrw as I start my radiotherapy.  I know I shouldn't be nervous as it's nothing compared to chemo. I'm getting to the stage that I'm wishing it was all over with. But 4 weeks isn't that long. It's the 5 days a week it's getting to me. I have more hair and I'm getting excited about that. I wish I can just wave a magic wand to have a full head of hair but it's coming in quite quick. Shouldn't be long until I can stop wearing bandanas.  Hopefully by the time my radiotherapy is finished I'll have enough hair. Val x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy. Hair is growing

Posts.Content: Aww I bet that felt so good carolyn. Really can't wait for my hair to grow longer  Val x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy. Hair is growing

Posts.Content: I just wish I hadn't taken the chemo and just did the radiotherapy as it's a doddle. Over and done with in no time  Val x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy. Hair is growing

Posts.Content: I can assure you hattie94 core biopsies are nothing at all like childbirth I done know who told you that When you get your biopsies they inject a local anesthesic. You don't feel a thing There's no point in worrying the now until you get your results Obviously at your age you will be scared  Try relax the now until you've got everything done as you might be on here for nothing Cyber hugs  Val
Posts.Title: 22yo terrified of core biopsy - and, well, everything

Posts.Content: Radiotherapy is a breeze. I even asked them is that it finished.  It's over so quick. Val x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy. Hair is growing

Posts.Content: Congratulations for getting thru the biopsies  Told you there was nothing to worry about. I've got my fingers crossed for your results Good luck Val x
Posts.Title: 22yo terrified of core biopsy - and, well, everything

Posts.Content: Congratulations  So happy for you  Val
Posts.Title: 22yo terrified of core biopsy - and, well, everything

Posts.Content: Hi karakeys  I wa diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma on 21st March.  It was really scary in the beggining  Not knowing what would happen  I was lucky it hadn't spread. It wasn't genetic either. I was the unlucky one in the family. I had 2 ops  First lumpectomy then they didn't get enough margin  Was going through chemo  Had my first 3 cycles then I was to go onto docetaxel. Which is the 2nd part of chemo. I couldn't handle chemo so I cancelled  But that was because I have other health problems that it had made worse. Plus with chemo I ended up with clots in both lungs. Which I give myself an injection every night.  Seemingly a lot of people get clots. It's natural. But not everyone gets them. Now I'm going to go through radiotherapy which I get my c.t scan tmrw to get things measured to see where they fire the beams. Getting told you have cancer is the scariest thing you'll ever hear but millions of people have gotten through it and so will you  Everyone here is brilliant and  no matter what time of day or night someone will be here for u. Don't be scared to ask questions about anything. You end up getting told a lot of things that somethings you might forget what you were told. Just try get through your operation and you should get your results within2 weeks. Until then I really hope you'll be ok. Val x
Posts.Title: Hi im newly diagnosed with invasive breast cancer, scared and looking...

Posts.Content: Hi kacang. Thankyou for asking how my breathing is. It seems to feel a little better. Haven't had a bad episode in 4 weeks so here's hoping it's all going ok  Val x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy. Hair is growing

Posts.Content: Got myself a really gift delivered today  It's recliner with heat and massage. It's so big and comfy. My friend built it for me. I've tried out the heat and massage and omg it's so great. Really good for when I'm in a lot of pain . Can't wait until dinner is ready then get my bath and sit back and relax. How's everyone doing  Hope all is well Sorry for the people that are just going through what I've been through but once it's over with its such a relief. I actually can't wait until may to see my surgeon for my reconstruction.  That'll be another couple of days in hospital but at least this time I have my frame so I can get about when I want too. Love & cyber hugs to you all  Val x
Posts.Title: Nice gift

Posts.Content: Hi always baking. I'm so glad I cancelled my taxotere.  Ive got enough problems without having anymore. Can't wait to get my radiotherapy over and done with.  Hope your next one goes better for you. Val x
Posts.Title: Oh Boy ! Fell At The First Taxotere Hurdle !!

Posts.Content: Hi karen 20.  I had my last fec going to docetaxel on monday. I lost my hair but still have eyelashes and eyebrows. I had a little bit of peeling on my feet too. I did find that a little strange.
Posts.Title: eyebrows, eyelashes and lizard feet

Posts.Content: Hi always baking. Hope your taxotere went well. I never got told anything about when I would lose my eyebrows and eyelashes. I'm going to ask them on Monday.  Thanks for that info Val x
Posts.Title: eyebrows, eyelashes and lizard feet

Posts.Content: When I first got my lumpectomy I asked my surgeon if I was more at risk of getting breast cancer again and she said I did as it was invasive. Even though it's a small risk. That I didn't understand as If your more at risk than other people then how can it be a small risk. Sounds double Dutch to me. Val x
Posts.Title: Increaseed risk of cancer in other breast -why?

Posts.Content: Congratulations  I'm so happy for you I'm hoping to get the same news in may Val
Posts.Title: It's been a year and I'm in the clear!

Posts.Content: Hi emj46.  I'm the exact same age as you and when I first went to see my doctor I had a very painful lump running from the side of my right breast to underneath so the GP thought it was a cyst. So I went for mammogram,ultra sound and biopsies. Not even thinking of cancer. I totally believed my GP  1 week later I got the results and had invasive ductal carcinoma grade 3.  Had lumpectomy  Didn't get enough margin so had 2nd op Got told in the first place I would most likely to get radiotherapy but possibly chemotherapy.  Now I've had 3 cycles of chemo and ready to get 3 cycles of docetaxel.  Told radiotherapy could be 3-4 weeks. Won't really know until chemo is finished. At first felt like my life was falling apart. Found it really hard.  I was the only one in my family to ever have cancer. Got told it was just one of those things. Really nice to know. Been doing really well with chemo itself but got other health problems  Now mobility really bad. Never in my life did I ever think that I would get cancer. When I got my results the tumor had  grown from being really small to 26 mm . That scared me a lot as it grew so fast. It hadn't spread which was really lucky.  Got 2 lymph nodes removed. At first when the gp had did the refferal it was about 5 weeks later when I had my app for mammogram.  The painful lump I felt had went right down and was really tiny so I was going to cancel my hospital app  I thought I better not so went anyway . I'm so glad I didn't cancel as my situation would be so different now. I wouldn't like to think how bad the cancer would've spread if I cancelled that app. Now I'm just taking each day as it comes and hoping when I get through the rest of my treatment I'll have about 7 months reprieve from hospital apps until I go back to the breast clinic . I keep checking all the time for lumps so I don't miss anything and I'll never cancel an app. Love n hugs  Val x
Posts.Title: New to the group and Not quite sure what I should be feeling?

Posts.Content: Got my perch stools, bath seat and forum cushion today. Awaiting on my occupational therapists to get in contact with me to assemble my bath chair and show me how to use it. Also got a visit from my GP today to see how I'm getting on with my morphine.  She's coming back next week as I've to keep a diary of when I'm using my morphine as she had told me about another tablet I can get.  It's a combination of my dihydrocodiene and morphine. I'm fed up of seeing meds. I've got so many alarms set on my phone to remind me when I've got too take meds.
Posts.Title: August chemo club. Multiple pulmonary embolisms.aids in house

Posts.Content: When I see my oncologist in may do I get my mammogram on the same day or do I have to go back for my mammogram  It's just I really don't want to have to travel back and forth for different apps  I've seen enough of the hospital to last me a life time Val x
Posts.Title: Onco app & mammogram

Posts.Content: I might call the hospital to find out if they'll do it the same day. I'm just so fed up with all the hospital appointments  It really gets me down I just want to get it all over and done with It takes an hour to get to hospital then your apps then the travel home again As I get patient transport and at times you have other patients that always get dropped of before me so it's a long day I'm always last Then by the time I get back home I'm in so much pain I'm looking forward to seeing my onco again but I just don't want numerous apps Val x
Posts.Title: Onco app & mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi optimistic I drank a lot of energy drinks when I went through chemo as it was the only thing that quenched my thirst You need as much energy as you can get Val x
Posts.Title: Can i drink lucozade on chemo

Posts.Content: Hi simba4me I had right sided idc, no node involvement  Had lumpectomy, chemo, radiotherapy  Which I finished Oct 2016 Because I'm under 50 and have really bad sweats I've to wait 2 yrs until I get another blood test, I did have a blood test which did say my levels were through the roof which means I'm going through the menopause,  Luckily in June my 2 yrs are up and I get My blood test which you go back for 6 weeks later and then they can officially say I'm going through the menopause, I got put on venlafaxine which sometimes work  It's so horrible having the sweats when you've never been like that before,  I haven't got a clue if they'll ever disappear  I really hope so as it's a nightmare trying to sleep,  Good luck in your journey to fight this horrible disease,  Val
Posts.Title: Sweats awful

Posts.Content: I'm with everyone else. I never had those symptoms either You would be better giving them a call and telling them how you feel Val x
Posts.Title: Side effects of EC chemotherapy?

Posts.Content: Hi juju68.  I'm not on tamoxifen and haven't had a period since  June 2016  My doctor told me if your under 50 they can't say your going through the menopause until you haven't had a period for 2 years.  Because I've started getting hot flushes again I had a blood test yesterday to check my hormone levels and get the results next Wednesday  Plus we can't get put on hrt because we've had breast cancer and there isn't any herbal remedies that have been tested but you can get anti depressants that help. One of which is fluoxetine or vanlafaxine Im not going to take fluoxetine as I've been on that years ago and it just about drove me mad I haven't got a clue about vanlafaxine as I've never heard of it.  Val x
Posts.Title: Chemo induced menopause / tamoxifen / tiredness
